original: Källner, Carl Gustaf Alfred, överste, Växjö, f. 23/8/95 i Trollhättan av kyrkoh. C.-A. Källner o. Claesine Lagercrantz. G. 24 m. Maja Radyn. Barn: Claes-Göran f. 28, Birgitta 33. Stud:ex. 13, KHS 22-24. Fänrik v. Västg. reg. 15, kapt. v. gen:staben 28, v. Svea livg. 34, major i gen:staben 36, öv:löjtn. i gen :’stabskåren 39, v. Uppl. reg. 40, v. Livreg. gren. 44, v. försv :staben 42, överste i armén 42, överste o. chef f. Kronob. reg. sed. 46. Lär. i kurser f. vpL läk. 28-34, v. inf:off:sk. 31-32, i taktik v. KHS 37-40, chef f. gen:stabens pressdet. 31- 34, sakk. i 30 års försv :komm. 34-35, sekt:chef v. försv :’staben 42-44, mil. led. av stat. inform :’styr. 40-45. Stud:-resor t. Finl. 31, Tyskl. 32, Schweiz 42. KS02kl, KV02kl, RFinlVROlkl, FS-ftj :k, SvlcfbSM, SthlmlSM, Sthlms skytteförb. SM.
translated: Källner, Carl Gustaf Alfred, Colonel, Växjö, b. 23/8/95 in Trollhättan, son of the church minister C.-A. Källner and Claesine Lagercrantz. Married on 24/xx with Maja Radyn. Children: Claes-Göran b. 28, Birgitta b. 33. Graduated from high school in 1913, attended the Royal Military Academy from 1922-1924. Ensign in the Västergötland Regiment in 1915, Captain in the General Staff in 1928, in the Svea Life Guards in 1934, Major in the General Staff in 1936, Lieutenant Colonel in the General Staff Corps in 1939, in the Uppland Regiment in 1940, in the Life Regiment Grenadier Guards in 1944, in the Army Staff in 1942, Colonel in the Army in 1942, Colonel and Chief of the Cronoberg Regiment since 1946. Teacher in courses for military medical personnel from 1928-1934, in the Infantry Officer School from 1931-1932, in tactics at the Royal Military Academy from 1937-1940, Chief of the General Staff's press department from 1931-1934, expert in the 30 years of defense commission from 1934-1935, Section Chief in the Army Staff from 1942-1944, military representative of the state information board from 1940-1945. Study trips to Finland in 1931, Germany in 1932, Switzerland in 1942. Knight of the Royal Order of the Sword of the 2nd Class, Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa of the 2nd Class, Knight of the Order of the White Rose of Finland of the 1st Class, Member of the Swedish Society for Military Sciences, Stockholm Shooting Society Medal, Stockholm Shooting Association Medal.

teachingCredential.description: Tactics at the Royal Military Academy

memberOfPoliticalOrganization.name: Order of the White Rose of Finland
